items.definition: A round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin  round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin  round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin  round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin
A tropical fruit with thick, dark green or purple skin, a large, round seed, and soft, pale green flesh that can be eaten
A small, round, soft fruit with a pale orange, furry skin
A long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside
The sweet fruit of various types of palm tree
A sweet, soft, purple, or green fruit with many seeds, or a tree on which these grow
A fruit that is like a large orange, but has a yellow skin and tastes less sweet
A small, round, purple or pale green fruit that you can eat or make into wine
An oval fruit with brown skin covered in hairs and bright green flesh
A round fruit containing a lot of juice that is sour like a lemon but smaller and green, or the small tree on which this fruit grows
An oval fruit that has a thick, yellow skin and sour juice, or the small tree on which this fruit grows
An oval tropical fruit with a smooth skin, orange-yellow flesh, and a large, hard seed in the middle
A large, round fruit with hard yellow or green skin, sweet flesh, and a lot of seeds
A type of sweet juicy fruit like a peach but with a smooth skin
A round sweet fruit that has a thick orange skin and an orange centre divided into many parts
A sweet fruit, usually with a green skin and a lot of juice, that has a round base and is slightly pointed towards the stem
A large oval fruit with a yellowish skin and sweet orange flesh, or the tropical tree on which this grows
(the yellow flesh and juice of) a large tropical fruit with a rough orange or brown skin and pointed leaves on top
A round fruit with sweet yellow flesh that has a lot of juice, a slightly furry red and yellow skin, and a large seed in its centre
A small, round fruit with a thin, smooth, red, purple, or yellow skin, sweet, soft flesh, and a single large, hard seed; the tree on which this fruit grows
A very sweet orange tropical fruit
A round, thick-skinned fruit containing a mass of red seeds and a lot of juice
A hard fruit that looks like an apple and has a strong sweet smell
A fruit like a small orange with a loose skin
A large, round or oval-shaped fruit with dark green skin, sweet pink flesh, and a lot of black seeds
